definition: delighted/to one's heart's content/straightforward/also pr. [tong4 kuai5]
immediately/without a moment's hesitation/with alacrity/firing from the hip

sentences.english: He felt browned off when he heard that he waw dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 當他聽到自己被解職時感到很不痛快。

sentences.english: It is years since I enjoyed myself so much.
sentences.chinese: 我好幾年沒玩得這樣痛快了。

sentences.english: We intend to have a ball at the amusement park today.
sentences.chinese: 我們打算今天到遊樂場玩個痛快。

sentences.english: There are times when I sit down and have a good weep.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我會坐下來痛痛快快地哭一場。

sentences.english: I could buy a place outright.
sentences.chinese: 我可以痛快的買個地方住。

sentences.english: We'll splurge on a trip in France next year.
sentences.chinese: 明年咱們去法國揮霍玩個痛快。

sentences.english: Let's have a fling and eat at that expensive restaurant for a change.
sentences.chinese: 咱們痛快一下，到那間高級餐館喫一頓來換換口味。

sentences.english: We are just going to make a night of it.
sentences.chinese: 我們要痛痛快快的玩它一個晚上。

sentences.english: The press and her opponents would have a field day digging into the dirty details of her background.
sentences.chinese: 媒體和對手可以痛快地深挖她不堪入目的醜聞。

sentences.english: We'll have a wonderful time tomorrow.
That summer with purple hair was absolutely amazing.
sentences.chinese: 頂着紫發的那個夏天，我過得痛快淋漓。

sentences.english: I would have a good long cry, and clasping you in my arms.
sentences.chinese: 我一定會抱住你，痛痛快快地哭一場。

sentences.english: Tom did play hookey, and he had a very good time.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆真的沒去上課，而且痛痛快快地玩了一場。

sentences.english: They jumped into the lake after finishing their chopping work and hurrayed out of joy.
sentences.chinese: 他們忙完手頭的活就撲騰撲騰地跳下湖，大叫痛快。

sentences.english: I've just come back from Thailand. An exciting trip.
sentences.chinese: 剛從泰國回來，玩得挺痛快。

sentences.english: We really enjoyed our holiday. The hotel was a home fro home for all its guests.
sentences.chinese: 我們在假日玩得真痛快，那旅店真是旅客之家。

definition: immediately/without a moment's hesitation/with alacrity/firing from the hip
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
(of speech or actions) direct and efficient/without fooling around
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
